etymologies: early 17th century: from ecclesiastical Greek katēkhētikos, from katēkhētēs ‘catechist’, from katēkhein ‘instruct orally’ (see catechize)

definitions: relating to religious instruction given to a person in preparation for Christian baptism or confirmation.
shortDefinitions: relating to religious instruction given in preparation for Christian baptism or confirmation

definitions: relating to religious teaching by means of questions and answers.
shortDefinitions: relating to religious teaching by means of questions and answers
